_comment: Created by ianb on 27/06/2014 16:22:09 using v2.1
title: Which organisations are responsible for the number of delayed days?
analysis_commentary: Trends in the length of delays are consistent with the trends in the number of patients delayed by organisation. The length of delays that patients are likely to experience when social care organisations are responsible for the delay has improved over time. However, the total number of delayed days accrued in a month when the delay is attributable to NHS organisations has increased by approximately 24%, so in the NHS there are more patients experiencing delays and the length of delays is also increasing.
data_source: NHS England, Delayed transfer of care
